description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a2f14","text":"This protocol describes the collection, processing, cryopreservation and thawing of pediatric bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) samples for downstream single cell analysis (including flow cytometry, cell sorting, and single cell transcriptomics).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Processing of pediatric bronchoalveolar lavage samples for single cell analysis

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1vkjp","text":"This is an experimental protocol for processing of bronchoalveolar lavage samples collected from children. references.title: Pulmonary immune profiling reveals common inflammatory endotypes of childhood wheeze and suppurative lung disease.
references.authors: Neeland MR, Gubbels L, Wong ATC, Walker H, Ranganathan SC, Shanthikumar S

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: COLLECTION OF BRONCHOALVEOLAR LAVAGE (BAL)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cqeh1","text":"After obtaining informed consent from family and/or patient, obtain any excess BAL fluid collected at the time of clinically indicated bronchoscopy and lavage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: COLLECTION OF BRONCHOALVEOLAR LAVAGE (BAL)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"m5kk","text":"For guidelines on how to safely perform bronchoscopy and lavage in children, please see:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b016","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3onu0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Faro A, Wood RE, Schechter MS, Leong AB, Wittkugel E, Abode K, Chmiel JF, Daines C, Davis S, Eber E, Huddleston C, Kilbaugh T, Kurland G, Midulla F, Molter D, Montgomery GS, Retsch-Bogart G, Rutter MJ, Visner G, Walczak SA, Ferkol TW, Michelson PH, American Thoracic Society Ad Hoc Committee on Flexible Airway Endoscopy in Children.","can_edit":1,"date":"1430438400","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1164/rccm.201503-0474ST","guid":"4960454A341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","journal":"American journal of respiratory and critical care medicine","protocol_id":"0","title":"Official American Thoracic Society technical standards: flexible airway endoscopy in children."}}}}

steps.section: COLLECTION OF BRONCHOALVEOLAR LAVAGE (BAL)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d3tfi","text":"BAL samples must be placed on ice and processed in the laboratory within 30 minutes -1 hour of the procedure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5nogd","text":"Centrifuge BAL samples at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":420,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"412CD7608ABA11EB90D19F417EB57138","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ef64","text":"Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 10mL of pre-chilled RPMI supplemented with 2% heat-inactivated fetal calf serum (herein referred to as RPMI 2% FCS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esuh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6pkv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ae8iu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":43}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7n4gn","text":"Cell-free BAL supernatant can be stored at    for future proteomic analysis (e.g. quantification of cytokines)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8CCFA2608ABA11EB90D19F417EB57138","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"r2b3","text":"Filter cell suspension through a 70-120µm cell strainer and centrifuge filtered cell suspension  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"836q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pvrn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6mn6q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":420,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CD0C9DDF8ABE11EBB46E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84seu","text":"In some cases, BAL samples may require a second filtering step to remove additional debris","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"rogs","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 3 mL RPMI 2% FCS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9v0nd","text":"Prepare cell suspension for cell counting. Here, we use AO/PI and the LUNA FL counter. Remove 18 µL for cell counting into a microcentrifuge tube. Add 2µL of AO/PI to the count tube and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ooaj","text":"Load 10µL of stained cells onto a Luna fluorescent counting slide and count. Record viability, total cell count, and live cell count.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsc9j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d509a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mrsv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c48jg","text":"Cell counting can be performed manually using a haemocytometer, or using other automated cell counters.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"6526CB4D98CA404C8C33BBE4D9DF26E9"}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF BAL TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7cvho","text":"If choosing to run flow cytometry or other single cell assays on fresh cells, here is where you can allocate the required number of cells for downstream processing. For flow cytometry, described below, we allocate 200-300,000 cells prior to proceeding to cryopreservation for remaining cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4mkhm","text":"Once the supernatant has been discarded, the cells are now ready to be resuspended at the required dilution for the first steps in your single cell experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4hq0c","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in 1mL RPMI 2%FCS for cell counting, followed by a final wash in 10mL RPMI 2%FCS and centrifuge at   at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":153,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"erf2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":420,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31F955708B5F11EBA357F5F0164AD372","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ghjo","text":"Centrifuge the cell suspension at   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73rmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":420,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"49A9B0608AC511EBA7D16520E7F91759","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fceqk","text":"Rinse cryovial with 1mL warmed thaw media to recover any remaining cells and transfer to the 15mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1glrm","text":"Using a pasteur pipette, transfer cells from cryovial into the 15mL tube containing warmed thaw media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58skl","text":"Place cryovials into the water bath for cell thawing, approximately  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bn3hn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"798D52608AC411EBA7D16520E7F91759","id":"80669","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"425vc","text":"Remove cryopreserved BAL samples from liquid nitrogen and keep on dry ice for transport to the laboratory.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: OPTION: THAWING OF CRYOPRESERVED BAL CELLS FOR SINGLE CELL ANALYSIS.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4ben","text":"If it is not possible to run single cell assays on fresh cells on the day of bronchoscopy, herein is a protocol for single cell analysis on cryopreserved and thawed BAL cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi1b4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ssdb","text":"Noting this will not enable efficient analysis of granulocytes, which were removed during the Ficoll gradient steps above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ckcn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea5lf","text":"Granulocytes are unlikely to survive a cryopreservation and thaw process even if whole BAL was cryopreserved. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION OF FRESH CELLS FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fcon","text":"Resuspend cell suspension for fixable viability staining according to manufacturers' instructions (e.g. the LIVE/DEAD‱ Fixable Near-IR Stain from Invitrogen/ThermoFisher). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3f30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebl4t","text":"Following the required incubation, stop the reaction by the addition of 1mL staining buffer (2% heat-inactivated FCS in PBMS 2mM EDTA, herein referred to as FACS buffer) and centrifuge at ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ka2j","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1E9DB6E5E65411EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7D25B9D402C811EF953C0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","name":":tm:","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fqtum","text":"Top up remaining cell suspension to 8mL with RPMI 2% FCS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dhd3q","text":"Fill a 15mL tube with 2mL of Ficoll plaque plus and layer the cell suspension onto the surface of the Ficoll solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kktn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a4cq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8c5e0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13q73","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8oeir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3bur4","text":"We choose to use a Ficoll gradient for cryopreservation. This is to remove fragile granulocytes that may affect viability of the sample upon thaw. We observe higher viability upon thaw following Ficoll preparation when compared to cryopreservation of whole BAL. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"2DBAD02BD331469987BA408CCDC1E7C7"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4rrvd","text":"Layer the cell suspension slowly to prevent the Ficoll solution from mixing with the cells. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"E9F39AB80BE145FE94A0CB41127D99F9"}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32hp3","text":"Centrifuge the layered cell suspension at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":1800,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1EE4FDBDE73911EE8E980A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"4 Acceleration and NO brake ","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ai4uu","text":"Once the spin is complete, carefully aspirate the mononuclear layer at the interface between the RPMI 2% FCS and the Ficoll solution into a new 15mL tube. Top up the cell suspension to 10mL with RPMI 2% FCS and centrifuge  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":222,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3lfnc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckcf0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aak8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2EA4252AE73911EE8E980A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a8aj2","text":"When collecting the cells, try to avoid Ficoll solution as much as possible.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"270120629EC7472DB6835E6DC3FF0872"}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"edgvu","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cells at a ratio of 1:1 in chilled RPMI 2% FCS and freeze solution (heat-inactivated FCS + 15% DMSO) such that cells are frozen between 1-10 million cells/mL. Transfer cells to cryogenic vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c49kq","text":"Immediately place cryogenic vials into an isopropanol freezing container (e.g. Nalgene® Mr. Frosty) and transfer to   overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"70E7F3B08AC211EBA7D16520E7F91759","id":"49842","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF BAL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"78a7v","text":"For long term storage, transfer vials to liquid nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
